message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.CV. 

The paper focuses on deep text matching approaches in a transfer learning setting, which is a common topic in the natural language processing (NLP) field. Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also proposes a novel reinforced data selector based on the actor-critic framework, which is a type of reinforcement learning, indicating that cs.LG (Machine Learning) is also a likely sub-category. Additionally, the paper involves policy optimization methods, which are commonly used in artificial intelligence (AI) research, suggesting cs.AI as another possible sub-category. The paper also evaluates the proposed method on two major tasks for text matching, namely, paraphrase identification and natural language inference, which are related to information retrieval (IR) and NLP, respectively, indicating cs.IR as another potential sub-category. Finally, the paper may also be relevant to computer vision (cs.CV) since it involves deep learning models.
